author: samcm

author: tbenr
content: Thanks!

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> I'm trying to sync with devnet 4 but getting ResourceUnavailable for my `BeaconBlockAndBlobsSidecarByR`ange messages from multiple peers. Shouldn't those blobs be available given that `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS` is ~ 17 days?

author: bridge-bot
content: <realbigsean> you would also get that response if the request was for a pre 4844 fork block

author: bridge-bot
content: <realbigsean> ah actually also pre finalization you can get that

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> True

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> but this is epoch 5

author: bridge-bot
content: <realbigsean> yes if it's finalized we aren't required to serve the blobs by root, only by range

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> Oops, sorry, I meant byRange (corrected initial message)

author: bridge-bot
content: <realbigsean> Oh yea by range you shouldn't get that reponse there then, any idea which client is sending it?

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> Hmm, I have the peer ID, is there a place/way to get the client from that?

author: bridge-bot
content: <realbigsean> in lighthouse we log our client info with peer ID somewhere so grepping the logs usually works. Checking your /eth/v1/node/peers endpoint would help too cause you can see the libp2p multiaddr and enr

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> it looks like there's a mix of nodes. three are definitely teku, but two others are not (can't tell which client they are though)

author: tbenr
content: We still have something to fix there, due to empty blobs handling.. checking right now..

author: skylenet
content: fyi: I'm restarting all nodes (with some minutes in between restarts) to apply some new bootnodes

author: skylenet
content: I've created this endpoint that spits out some infos for all clients that we're running, including the peer_id: https://bootnode-1.server.4844-devnet-4.ethpandaops.io/meta/api/v1/inventory.json

author: bridge-bot
content: <henridf> Ah nice! Yep so all nodes returning ResourceUnavailable are Teku. Next I need to look into why I'm not peering with other clients...
